instructions.name: initializeProgramConfig
docs: Initialize the program config.

accounts.name: initializer
docs: The hard-coded account that is used to initialize the program config once.

instructions.name: setProgramConfigAuthority
docs: Set the `authority` parameter of the program config.

instructions.name: setProgramConfigSmartAccountCreationFee
docs: Set the `smart_account_creation_fee` parameter of the program config.

instructions.name: setProgramConfigTreasury
docs: Set the `treasury` parameter of the program config.

instructions.name: createSmartAccount
docs: Create a smart account.

accounts.name: programConfig
docs: Global program config account.

accounts.name: treasury
docs: The treasury where the creation fee is transferred to.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The creator of the smart account.

instructions.name: addSignerAsAuthority
docs: Add a new signer to the controlled smart account.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the settings account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new signer or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: removeSignerAsAuthority
docs: Remove a signer from the controlled smart account.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the settings account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new signer or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: setTimeLockAsAuthority
docs: Set the `time_lock` config parameter for the controlled smart account.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the settings account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new signer or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: changeThresholdAsAuthority
docs: Set the `threshold` config parameter for the controlled smart account.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the settings account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new signer or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: setNewSettingsAuthorityAsAuthority
docs: Set the smart account `settings_authority`.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the settings account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new signer or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: setArchivalAuthorityAsAuthority
docs: Set the smart account `archival_authority`.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged or credited in case the settings account needs to reallocate space,
for example when adding a new signer or a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: addSpendingLimitAsAuthority
docs: Create a new spending limit for the controlled smart account.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

instructions.name: removeSpendingLimitAsAuthority
docs: Remove the spending limit from the controlled smart account.

accounts.name: settingsAuthority
docs: Settings `settings_authority` that must authorize the configuration change.

accounts.name: rentCollector
docs: This is usually the same as `settings_authority`, but can be a different account if needed.

instructions.name: createSettingsTransaction
docs: Create a new settings transaction.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The signer on the smart account that is creating the transaction.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The payer for the transaction account rent.

instructions.name: executeSettingsTransaction
docs: Execute a settings transaction.
The transaction must be `Approved`.

accounts.name: settings
docs: The settings account of the smart account that owns the transaction.

accounts.name: signer
docs: The signer on the smart account that is executing the transaction.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the transaction.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: The transaction to execute.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged/credited in case the settings transaction causes space reallocation,
for example when adding a new signer, adding or removing a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `signer`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: createTransaction
docs: Create a new vault transaction.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The member of the multisig that is creating the transaction.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The payer for the transaction account rent.

instructions.name: createTransactionBuffer
docs: Create a transaction buffer account.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The signer on the smart account that is creating the transaction.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The payer for the transaction account rent.

instructions.name: closeTransactionBuffer
docs: Close a transaction buffer account.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The signer on the smart account that created the TransactionBuffer.

instructions.name: extendTransactionBuffer
docs: Extend a transaction buffer account.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The signer on the smart account that created the TransactionBuffer.

instructions.name: createTransactionFromBuffer
docs: Create a new vault transaction from a completed transaction buffer.
Finalized buffer hash must match `final_buffer_hash`

accounts.name: creator
docs: The member of the multisig that is creating the transaction.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The payer for the transaction account rent.

instructions.name: executeTransaction
docs: Execute a smart account transaction.
The transaction must be `Approved`.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the transaction.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: The transaction to execute.

instructions.name: createBatch
docs: Create a new batch.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The signer of the settings that is creating the batch.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The payer for the batch account rent.

instructions.name: addTransactionToBatch
docs: Add a transaction to the batch.

accounts.name: settings
docs: Consensus account this batch belongs to.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the batch.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: `BatchTransaction` account to initialize and add to the `batch`.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Signer of the smart account.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The payer for the batch transaction account rent.

instructions.name: executeBatchTransaction
docs: Execute a transaction from the batch.

accounts.name: settings
docs: Consensus account this batch belongs to.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Signer of the settings.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: The proposal account associated with the batch.
If `transaction` is the last in the batch, the `proposal` status will be set to `Executed`.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: Batch transaction to execute.

instructions.name: createProposal
docs: Create a new smart account proposal.

accounts.name: creator
docs: The signer on the smart account that is creating the proposal.

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The payer for the proposal account rent.

instructions.name: activateProposal
docs: Update status of a smart account proposal from `Draft` to `Active`.

instructions.name: approveProposal
docs: Approve a smart account proposal on behalf of the `member`.
The proposal must be `Active`.

instructions.name: rejectProposal
docs: Reject a smart account proposal on behalf of the `member`.
The proposal must be `Active`.

instructions.name: cancelProposal
docs: Cancel a smart account proposal on behalf of the `member`.
The proposal must be `Approved`.

instructions.name: useSpendingLimit
docs: Use a spending limit to transfer tokens from a smart account vault to a destination account.

accounts.name: settings
docs: The settings the `spending_limit` belongs to.

accounts.name: spendingLimit
docs: The SpendingLimit account to use.

accounts.name: smartAccount
docs: Smart account to transfer tokens from.

accounts.name: destination
docs: Destination account to transfer tokens to.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: In case `spending_limit.mint` is SOL.

accounts.name: mint
docs: The mint of the tokens to transfer in case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

accounts.name: smartAccountTokenAccount
docs: Smart account token account to transfer tokens from in case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

accounts.name: destinationTokenAccount
docs: Destination token account in case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

accounts.name: tokenProgram
docs: In case `spending_limit.mint` is an SPL token.

instructions.name: closeSettingsTransaction
docs: Closes a `SettingsTransaction` and the corresponding `Proposal`.
`transaction` can be closed if either:
- the `proposal` is in a terminal state: `Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled`.
- the `proposal` is stale.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: the logic within `settings_transaction_close` does the rest of the checks.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: SettingsTransaction corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: proposalRentCollector
docs: The rent payer for the proposal account.

accounts.name: transactionRentCollector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: closeTransaction
docs: Closes a `Transaction` and the corresponding `Proposal`.
`transaction` can be closed if either:
- the `proposal` is in a terminal state: `Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled`.
- the `proposal` is stale and not `Approved`.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: the logic within `transaction_close` does the rest of the checks.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: Transaction corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: proposalRentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the proposal account.

accounts.name: transactionRentCollector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: closeEmptyPolicyTransaction
docs: Closes a `Transaction` and the corresponding `Proposal` for
empty/deleted policies.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: the logic within `transaction_close` does the rest of the checks.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: Transaction corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: proposalRentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the proposal account.

accounts.name: transactionRentCollector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: closeBatchTransaction
docs: Closes a `BatchTransaction` belonging to the `batch` and `proposal`.
`transaction` can be closed if either:
- it's marked as executed within the `batch`;
- the `proposal` is in a terminal state: `Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled`.
- the `proposal` is stale and not `Approved`.

accounts.name: batch
docs: `Batch` corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: transaction
docs: `BatchTransaction` account to close.
The transaction must be the current last one in the batch.

accounts.name: transactionRentCollector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: closeBatch
docs: Closes Batch and the corresponding Proposal accounts for proposals in terminal states:
`Executed`, `Rejected`, or `Cancelled` or stale proposals that aren't `Approved`.
This instruction is only allowed to be executed when all `VaultBatchTransaction` accounts
in the `batch` are already closed: `batch.size == 0`.

accounts.name: proposal
docs: the logic within `close_batch` does the rest of the checks.

accounts.name: batch
docs: `Batch` corresponding to the `proposal`.

accounts.name: proposalRentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the proposal account.

accounts.name: batchRentCollector
docs: The rent collector.

instructions.name: executeTransactionSync
docs: Synchronously execute a transaction

instructions.name: executeTransactionSyncV2
docs: Synchronously execute a policy transaction

instructions.name: executeSettingsTransactionSync
docs: Synchronously execute a config transaction

accounts.name: rentPayer
docs: The account that will be charged/credited in case the settings transaction causes space reallocation,
for example when adding a new signer, adding or removing a spending limit.
This is usually the same as `signer`, but can be a different account if needed.

accounts.name: systemProgram
docs: We might need it in case reallocation is needed.

instructions.name: logEvent
docs: Log an event

accounts.name: Batch
docs: Stores data required for serial execution of a batch of smart account transactions.
A smart account transaction is a transaction that's executed on behalf of the smart account
and wraps arbitrary Solana instructions, typically calling into other Solana programs.
The transactions themselves are stored in separate PDAs associated with the this account.

fields.name: settings
docs: The consensus account (settings or policy) this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Signer of the smart account who submitted the batch.

fields.name: rentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the batch account.

fields.name: index
docs: Index of this batch within the smart account transactions.

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: Index of the smart account this batch belongs to.

fields.name: accountBump
docs: Derivation bump of the smart account PDA this batch belongs to.

fields.name: size
docs: Number of transactions in the batch.

fields.name: executedTransactionIndex
docs: Index of the last executed transaction within the batch.
0 means that no transactions have been executed yet.

accounts.name: BatchTransaction
docs: Stores data required for execution of one transaction from a batch.

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: rentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the batch transaction account.

fields.name: ephemeralSignerBumps
docs: Derivation bumps for additional signers.
Some transactions require multiple signers. Often these additional signers are "ephemeral" keypairs
that are generated on the client with a sole purpose of signing the transaction and be discarded immediately after.
When wrapping such transactions into Smart Account ones, we replace these "ephemeral" signing keypairs
with PDAs derived from the transaction's `transaction_index` and controlled by the Smart Account Program;
during execution the program includes the seeds of these PDAs into the `invoke_signed` calls,
thus "signing" on behalf of these PDAs.

fields.name: message
docs: data required for executing the transaction.

accounts.name: LegacyTransaction
docs: Stores data required for tracking the voting and execution status of a smart
account transaction.
Smart Account transaction is a transaction that's executed on behalf of the
smart account PDA
and wraps arbitrary Solana instructions, typically calling into other Solana programs.

fields.name: smartAccountSettings
docs: The consensus account this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Signer of the Smart Account who submitted the transaction.

fields.name: rentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the transaction account.

fields.name: index
docs: Index of this transaction within the smart account.

fields.name: bump
docs: bump for the transaction seeds.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: The account index of the smart account this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: accountBump
docs: Derivation bump of the smart account PDA this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: ephemeralSignerBumps
docs: Derivation bumps for additional signers.
Some transactions require multiple signers. Often these additional signers are "ephemeral" keypairs
that are generated on the client with a sole purpose of signing the transaction and be discarded immediately after.
When wrapping such transactions into smart account ones, we replace these "ephemeral" signing keypairs
with PDAs derived from the SmartAccountTransaction's `transaction_index`
and controlled by the Smart Account Program;
during execution the program includes the seeds of these PDAs into the `invoke_signed` calls,
thus "signing" on behalf of these PDAs.

fields.name: message
docs: data required for executing the transaction.

fields.name: settings
docs: The smart account this policy belongs to.

fields.name: seed
docs: The seed of the policy.

fields.name: transactionIndex
docs: Transaction index for stale transaction protection.

fields.name: staleTransactionIndex
docs: Stale transaction index boundary.

fields.name: signers
docs: Signers attached to the policy with their permissions.

fields.name: threshold
docs: Threshold for approvals.

fields.name: timeLock
docs: How many seconds must pass between approval and execution.

fields.name: policyState
docs: The state of the policy.

fields.name: start
docs: Timestamp when the policy becomes active.

fields.name: expiration
docs: Policy expiration - either time-based or state-based.

accounts.name: ProgramConfig
docs: Global program configuration account.

fields.name: smartAccountIndex
docs: Counter for the number of smart accounts created.

fields.name: authority
docs: The authority which can update the config.

fields.name: smartAccountCreationFee
docs: The lamports amount charged for creating a new smart account.
This fee is sent to the `treasury` account.

fields.name: treasury
docs: The treasury account to send charged fees to.

fields.name: reserved
docs: Reserved for future use.

accounts.name: Proposal
docs: Stores the data required for tracking the status of a smart account proposal.
Each `Proposal` has a 1:1 association with a transaction account, e.g. a `Transaction` or a `SettingsTransaction`;
the latter can be executed only after the `Proposal` has been approved and its time lock is released.

fields.name: settings
docs: The consensus account (settings or policy) this belongs to.

fields.name: transactionIndex
docs: Index of the smart account transaction this proposal is associated with.

fields.name: rentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the proposal account.

fields.name: status
docs: The status of the transaction.

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: approved
docs: Keys that have approved/signed.

fields.name: rejected
docs: Keys that have rejected.

fields.name: cancelled
docs: Keys that have cancelled (Approved only).

accounts.name: SettingsTransaction
docs: Stores data required for execution of a settings configuration transaction.
Settings transactions can perform a predefined set of actions on the Settings PDA, such as adding/removing members,
changing the threshold, etc.

fields.name: settings
docs: The settings this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Signer on the settings who submitted the transaction.

fields.name: rentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the settings transaction account.

fields.name: index
docs: Index of this transaction within the settings.

fields.name: bump
docs: bump for the transaction seeds.

fields.name: actions
docs: Action to be performed on the settings.

fields.name: seed
docs: An integer that is used seed the settings PDA. Its incremented by 1
inside the program conifg by 1 for each smart account created. This is
to ensure uniqueness of each settings PDA without relying on user input.
Note: As this represents a DOS vector in the current creation architecture,
account creation will be permissioned until compression is implemented.

fields.name: settingsAuthority
docs: The authority that can change the smart account settings.
This is a very important parameter as this authority can change the signers and threshold.
The convention is to set this to `Pubkey::default()`.
In this case, the smart account becomes autonomous, so every settings change goes through
the normal process of voting by the signers.
However, if this parameter is set to any other key, all the setting changes for this smart account settings
will need to be signed by the `settings_authority`. We call such a smart account a "controlled smart account".

fields.name: threshold
docs: Threshold for signatures.

fields.name: timeLock
docs: How many seconds must pass between transaction voting settlement and execution.

fields.name: transactionIndex
docs: Last transaction index. 0 means no transactions have been created.

fields.name: staleTransactionIndex
docs: Last stale transaction index. All transactions up until this index are stale.
This index is updated when smart account settings (signers/threshold/time_lock) change.

fields.name: archivalAuthority
docs: Field reserved for when archival/compression is implemented.
Will be set to Pubkey::default() to mark accounts that should
be eligible for archival before the feature is implemented.

fields.name: archivableAfter
docs: Field that will prevent a smart account from being archived immediately after unarchival.
This is to prevent a DOS vector where the archival authority could
constantly unarchive and archive the smart account to prevent it from
being used.

fields.name: bump
docs: Bump for the smart account PDA seed.

fields.name: signers
docs: Signers attached to the smart account

fields.name: accountUtilization
docs: Counter for how many sub accounts are in use (improves off-chain indexing)

fields.name: policySeed
docs: Seed used for deterministic policy creation.

fields.name: settings
docs: The settings this belongs to.

fields.name: seed
docs: Key that is used to seed the SpendingLimit PDA.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: The index of the smart account that the spending limit is for.

fields.name: mint
docs: The token mint the spending limit is for.
Pubkey::default() means SOL.
use NATIVE_MINT for Wrapped SOL.

fields.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens that can be spent in a period.
This amount is in decimals of the mint,
so 1 SOL would be `1_000_000_000` and 1 USDC would be `1_000_000`.

fields.name: period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.
When it passes, the remaining amount is reset, unless it's `Period::OneTime`.

fields.name: remainingAmount
docs: The remaining amount of tokens that can be spent in the current period.
When reaches 0, the spending limit cannot be used anymore until the period reset.

fields.name: lastReset
docs: Unix timestamp marking the last time the spending limit was reset (or created).

fields.name: bump
docs: PDA bump.

fields.name: signers
docs: Signers that can use the spending limit.

fields.name: destinations
docs: The destination addresses the spending limit is allowed to sent funds to.
If empty, funds can be sent to any address.

fields.name: expiration
docs: The expiration timestamp of the spending limit.

fields.name: settings
docs: The consensus account (settings or policy) this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Signer of the smart account who created the TransactionBuffer.

fields.name: bufferIndex
docs: Index to seed address derivation

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: Smart account index of the transaction this buffer belongs to.

fields.name: finalBufferHash
docs: Hash of the final assembled transaction message.

fields.name: finalBufferSize
docs: The size of the final assembled transaction message.

fields.name: buffer
docs: The buffer of the transaction message.

accounts.name: Transaction
docs: Stores data required for tracking the voting and execution status of a smart
account transaction or policy action
Smart Account transaction is a transaction that's executed on behalf of the
smart account PDA
and wraps arbitrary Solana instructions, typically calling into other Solana programs.

fields.name: consensusAccount
docs: The consensus account this belongs to.

fields.name: creator
docs: Signer of the Smart Account who submitted the transaction.

fields.name: rentCollector
docs: The rent collector for the transaction account.

fields.name: index
docs: Index of this transaction within the consensus account.

fields.name: payload
docs: The payload of the transaction.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: seed
docs: Key that is used to seed the SpendingLimit PDA.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: The index of the smart account that the spending limit is for.

fields.name: mint
docs: The token mint the spending limit is for.

fields.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens that can be spent in a period.
This amount is in decimals of the mint,
so 1 SOL would be `1_000_000_000` and 1 USDC would be `1_000_000`.

fields.name: period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.
When it passes, the remaining amount is reset, unless it's `Period::OneTime`.

fields.name: signers
docs: Signers of the Spending Limit that can use it.
Don't have to be signers of the settings.

fields.name: destinations
docs: The destination addresses the spending limit is allowed to sent funds to.
If empty, funds can be sent to any address.

fields.name: expiration
docs: The expiration timestamp of the spending limit.
Non expiring spending limits are set to `i64::MAX`.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: ephemeralSigners
docs: Number of ephemeral signing PDAs required by the transaction.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: Index of the smart account this batch belongs to.

fields.name: authority
docs: The authority that can configure the program config: change the treasury, etc.

fields.name: smartAccountCreationFee
docs: The fee that is charged for creating a new smart account.

fields.name: treasury
docs: The treasury where the creation fee is transferred to.

fields.name: transactionIndex
docs: Index of the smart account transaction this proposal is associated with.

fields.name: draft
docs: Whether the proposal should be initialized with status `Draft`.

fields.name: numSigners
docs: The number of signers to reach threshold and adequate permissions

fields.name: actions
docs: The settings actions to execute

fields.name: settingsAuthority
docs: The authority that can configure the smart account: add/remove signers, change the threshold, etc.
Should be set to `None` for autonomous smart accounts.

fields.name: threshold
docs: The number of signatures required to execute a transaction.

fields.name: signers
docs: The signers on the smart account.

fields.name: timeLock
docs: How many seconds must pass between transaction voting, settlement, and execution.

fields.name: rentCollector
docs: The address where the rent for the accounts related to executed, rejected, or cancelled
transactions can be reclaimed. If set to `None`, the rent reclamation feature is turned off.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo is used for indexing only.

fields.name: bufferIndex
docs: Index of the buffer account to seed the account derivation

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: Index of the smart account this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: finalBufferHash
docs: Hash of the final assembled transaction message.

fields.name: finalBufferSize
docs: Final size of the buffer.

fields.name: buffer
docs: Initial slice of the buffer.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: The index of the smart account this transaction is for

fields.name: numSigners
docs: The number of signers to reach threshold and adequate permissions

fields.name: instructions
docs: Expected to be serialized as a SmallVec<u8, CompiledInstruction>

fields.name: amount
docs: Amount of tokens to transfer.

fields.name: decimals
docs: Decimals of the token mint. Used for double-checking against incorrect order of magnitude of `amount`.

fields.name: memo
docs: Memo used for indexing.

fields.name: numSigners
docs: The number of signer pubkeys in the account_keys vec.

fields.name: numWritableSigners
docs: The number of writable signer pubkeys in the account_keys vec.

fields.name: numWritableNonSigners
docs: The number of writable non-signer pubkeys in the account_keys vec.

fields.name: accountKeys
docs: Unique account pubkeys (including program IDs) required for execution of the tx.
The signer pubkeys appear at the beginning of the vec, with writable pubkeys first, and read-only pubkeys following.
The non-signer pubkeys follow with writable pubkeys first and read-only ones following.
Program IDs are also stored at the end of the vec along with other non-signer non-writable pubkeys:
```plaintext
[pubkey1, pubkey2, pubkey3, pubkey4, pubkey5, pubkey6, pubkey7, pubkey8]
|---writable---|  |---readonly---|  |---writable---|  |---readonly---|

fields.name: instructions
docs: List of instructions making up the tx.

fields.name: addressTableLookups
docs: List of address table lookups used to load additional accounts
for this transaction.

types.name: SmartAccountCompiledInstruction
docs: Concise serialization schema for instructions that make up a transaction.
Closely mimics the Solana transaction wire format.

fields.name: accountIndexes
docs: Indices into the tx's `account_keys` list indicating which accounts to pass to the instruction.

fields.name: data
docs: Instruction data.

types.name: SmartAccountMessageAddressTableLookup
docs: Address table lookups describe an on-chain address lookup table to use
for loading more readonly and writable accounts into a transaction.

fields.name: accountKey
docs: Address lookup table account key.

fields.name: writableIndexes
docs: List of indexes used to load writable accounts.

fields.name: readonlyIndexes
docs: List of indexes used to load readonly accounts.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: The account index of the account that will be used to execute the policy

fields.name: accountConstraints
docs: Constraints will be evaluated as a logical AND.

fields.name: dataConstraints
docs: Constraints will be evaluated as a logical AND.

types.name: LimitedTimeConstraints
docs: Limited subset of TimeConstraints.

types.name: LimitedQuantityConstraints
docs: Limited subset of QuantityConstraints

types.name: LimitedSpendingLimit
docs: Limited subset of BalanceConstraint used to create a policy

types.name: ProgramInteractionPolicyCreationPayload
docs: Payload used to create a program interaction policy

types.name: SpendingLimitPolicy
docs: Enhanced period enum supporting custom durations
Main spending limit structure using composition

fields.name: spendingLimit
docs: Spending limit configuration (timing, constraints, usage, mint)

fields.name: sourceAccountIndex
docs: The source account index.

fields.name: destinations
docs: The destination addresses the spending limit is allowed to sent funds to.
If empty, funds can be sent to any address.

types.name: SpendingLimitPolicyCreationPayload
docs: Setup parameters for creating a spending limit

types.name: SpendingLimitPayload
docs: Payload for using a spending limit policy.

types.name: TimeConstraints
docs: Configuration for time-based constraints

fields.name: start
docs: Optional start timestamp (0 means immediate)

fields.name: expiration
docs: Optional expiration timestamp

fields.name: period
docs: Reset period for the spending limit

fields.name: accumulateUnused
docs: Whether unused allowances accumulate across periods

types.name: QuantityConstraints
docs: Quantity constraints for spending limits

fields.name: maxPerPeriod
docs: Maximum quantity per period

fields.name: maxPerUse
docs: Maximum quantity per individual use (0 means no per-use limit)

fields.name: enforceExactQuantity
docs: Whether to enforce exact quantity matching on max per use.

types.name: UsageState
docs: Usage tracking for resource consumption

fields.name: remainingInPeriod
docs: Remaining quantity in current period

fields.name: lastReset
docs: Unix timestamp of last reset

types.name: SpendingLimitV2
docs: Shared spending limit structure that combines timing, quantity, usage, and mint

fields.name: mint
docs: The token mint the spending limit is for.
Pubkey::default() means SOL.
use NATIVE_MINT for Wrapped SOL.

fields.name: timeConstraints
docs: Timing configuration

fields.name: quantityConstraints
docs: Amount constraints

fields.name: usage
docs: Current usage tracking

types.name: Permissions
docs: Bitmask for permissions.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: The account index of the smart account this transaction belongs to.

fields.name: ephemeralSignerBumps
docs: The ephemeral signer bumps for the transaction.

fields.name: message
docs: The message of the transaction.

fields.name: payload
docs: The payload of the policy transaction.

types.name: AllowedSettingsChange
docs: Supports a subset of settings changes that can be done via a policy.

types.name: LimitedSettingsAction
docs: Limited subset of settings change actions

types.name: PolicyCreationPayload
docs: Unified enum for all policy creation payloads
These are used in SettingsAction::PolicyCreate to specify which type of policy to create

types.name: PolicyPayload
docs: Unified enum for all policy execution payloads

types.name: PolicyExecutionContext
docs: The context in which the policy is being executed

types.name: ProposalStatus
docs: The status of a proposal.
Each variant wraps a timestamp of when the status was set.

fields.name: seed
docs: Key that is used to seed the SpendingLimit PDA.

fields.name: accountIndex
docs: The index of the account that the spending limit is for.

fields.name: mint
docs: The token mint the spending limit is for.

fields.name: amount
docs: The amount of tokens that can be spent in a period.
This amount is in decimals of the mint,
so 1 SOL would be `1_000_000_000` and 1 USDC would be `1_000_000`.

fields.name: period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.
When it passes, the remaining amount is reset, unless it's `Period::OneTime`.

fields.name: signers
docs: Members of the settings that can use the spending limit.
In case a member is removed from the settings, the spending limit will remain existent
(until explicitly deleted), but the removed member will not be able to use it anymore.

fields.name: destinations
docs: The destination addresses the spending limit is allowed to sent funds to.
If empty, funds can be sent to any address.

fields.name: expiration
docs: The expiration timestamp of the spending limit.
Non expiring spending limits are set to `i64::MAX`.

fields.name: seed
docs: Key that is used to seed the Policy PDA.

fields.name: policyCreationPayload
docs: The policy creation payload containing policy-specific configuration.

fields.name: signers
docs: Signers attached to the policy with their permissions.

fields.name: threshold
docs: Threshold for approvals on the policy.

fields.name: timeLock
docs: How many seconds must pass between approval and execution.

fields.name: startTimestamp
docs: Timestamp when the policy becomes active.

fields.name: expirationArgs
docs: Policy expiration - either time-based or state-based.

fields.name: policy
docs: The policy account to update.

fields.name: signers
docs: Signers attached to the policy with their permissions.

fields.name: threshold
docs: Threshold for approvals on the policy.

fields.name: timeLock
docs: How many seconds must pass between approval and execution.

fields.name: policyUpdatePayload
docs: The policy update payload containing policy-specific configuration.

fields.name: expirationArgs
docs: Policy expiration - either time-based or state-based.

fields.name: policy
docs: The policy account to remove.

types.name: Period
docs: The reset period of the spending limit.
